physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient presented with right subscapular pain, dyspnea, fever, cough, and hemoptysis. Six hours after admission, he developed a stuporous state and mottled skin.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's condition deteriorated over six hours, evolving from initial symptoms to a stuporous state and mottled skin.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Arterial blood gas analysis showed respiratory and lactic acidosis (pH 7.1, pO2 45 mmHg, PaCO2 42 mmHg, HCO3- 16.5 mmol/L, BE -15.8 mmol/L, lactates 9.7 mmol/L). Repeat chest X-ray showed complete right upper lobe, right lower, and left mid-basal opacification, with diffuse thickening of the bilateral lower-middle lung.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient exhibited worsening respiratory function as indicated by progressive hypoxia and changes seen on chest X-ray.
